jobs.title: Backend Engineer
jobs.description:
Numan provides medicine for men and knowledge for everyone. We’re building a platform that gives men direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge to make informed decisions about their health. But we don’t stop there. For us, it’s a mission as much as it is a business. One to help men — and all that know them — live healthier, happier lives.

Our ambitions are big, we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re growing a team to surpass them.

We are looking for a Backend Engineer to join our motivated and growing team. We are a fast-moving, agile team made up of experienced engineers that take pride in our work. Joining at the start of our journey means you will be making a huge impact on the ways that we develop and execute.

Technology Stack

Here are the main pieces of technology and tools that we are currently using:

* Ruby (and a bit of Golang), Rails, RSpec, PostgreSQL, Redis and Memcached for our web API services
* Node.js, Vue.js with Vuex and Nuxt.js, ES6, SCSS, Jest (and a bit of Cypress) and Webpack for our website
* Git, GitHub, CircleCI for our code and continuous integration/deployment
* Heroku and Cloudflare for our infrastructure
* Sentry, New Relic and Skylight for monitoring
* Jira for keeping us on track

What will you do?

You will be working in the API team, designing, implementing, maintaining, scaling and deploying the core of our business.

* Be instrumental in building a health platform that helps men take better care of themselves.
* Be hands-on with coding, best practices, appropriate tools and technologies. We are currently using Ruby and Golang in the web API services, however, we are flexible with considering alternatives wherever these are better for the business.
* Work with other parts of the business in clarifying requirements at the onset of projects and suggesting different and relevant technical approaches.

Requirements

* Have basic to intermediate engineering experience. Ruby and Rails or Golang would be great, however, we are not fussy as long as you are able to adapt.
* Have basic knowledge in SQL and know your way around relational databases.
* Have basic understanding in web APIs and distributed systems.
* Are self-learning and have a strong desire to become a better engineer by writing code that you are proud of.
* Have solid communication skills. You are able to work in cross-functional teams and collaborate effectively with remote team members.
* Take pride in your work and are always looking to improve, not settling for average.
* Want to work for a brand with purpose.
* Have a bias for action and are results-focused.

Benefits

* A competitive salary.
* Own a share of the business.
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
* Choose your own equipment - Mac or PC whatever helps you be the most productive.
* Continuous learning - Books, online subscriptions and budget for workshops and conferences
* A flexible and remote friendly working environment that allows you to work how you work best.
* A chance to build a category-defining company that’s making a real difference in people’s lives.

jobs.title: CRM Manager
jobs.description:
Numan is changing the way men look after their health and wellness. We’re building a platform that gives direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge to make informed decisions about your health. We’re building a platform that gives you direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and knowledge to make informed decisions that are right for you. Our mission is to help men across the world live healthier, happier lives with Numan as their trusted, long-term partner for all things relating to their wellbeing.

Our ambitions are big, we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re growing a team to surpass them.

We are hiring a CRM Manager to enhance our communication to existing patients, prospective patients or men who just want to learn a little more about how to do something about their health.

This role will suit someone with experience running CRM campaigns from a high level, but isn’t afraid to get their hands dirty with analytics and data integrations as we’ll be building the platform from the ground up to your designs.


What you will be doing:

Strategic:

· Defining the metrics that we optimise against, and then delivering those metrics as OKRs.

· Liaise with the wider marketing and customer services teams to establish seamless brand communications across all our channels.

· Working with the product team to make sure that the data that underpins the CRM programme is robust enough to allow multiple ongoing tests.

Operational:

· Managing end to end workflow of CRM campaigns to optimise customer lifetime value through email, physical and SMS/push communications.

· Build out V1 of our full lifecycle program.

· Create a campaign calendar in conjunction with the marketing function to communicate with existing customers and maximise engagement with Numan products.

· Launch new products into market to existing users.

· Working with design resources internally and externally to make sure we have first in class creative output that performs.

· Analysing performance of cohorts through multivariate and A/B testing, and coming up with plans to take that performance to the next level.

· Maintaining integrations with third party software to ensure constant data integrity in the system under your control.

Requirements

· 2+ years of CRM experience, either in-house or agency-side.

· Proven knowledge of one or more email platform (Drip, Mailchimp, Dotmailer etc).

· Explicit knowledge of A/B and Multivariate testing in the CRM space.

· Experience working with third party data integration solutions like Segment or Ometria would be beneficial but not essential.

· A curious mindset – you want to understand how things work and how you can improve them.

· A self-motivated and organised attitude. It's fast-paced here, so you'll need to be able to think on your feet and manage your time and projects.

Benefits

· A competitive salary.

· 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
· Own a share of the business.
· Choose your own equipment - Mac or PC whatever helps you be the most productive.
· A flexible working environment that allows you to work how you work best.
· A chance to build a category-defining company that’s making a real difference in people’s lives.

APPLY FOR THIS JOB (https://workable.com/nr?l=https%3A%2F%2Fnuman.teamtailor.com%2Fjobs%2F813731-crm-manager%2Fapplications%2Fnew)

jobs.title: Growth Manager - PPC
jobs.description:
Numan is changing the way men look after their health and wellness. We’re building a platform that gives direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge to make informed decisions about your health. We’re building a platform that gives you direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and knowledge to make informed decisions that are right for you. Our mission is to help men across the world live healthier, happier lives with Numan as their trusted, long-term partner for all things relating to their wellbeing.

Our ambitions are big, we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re growing a team to surpass them.

We are hiring a Growth Manager to take over day to day management of our PPC campaigns across Google & Bing to take the work and success we've had in this area to the next level.

This role will suit someone who has experience building best in class PPC campaigns from the ground up, isn't afraid to get their hands dirty but also has the strategic capacity to see the bigger picture and drive profitable growth.


Strategic:

· Defining the metrics that we optimise against, and then delivering those metrics as OKRs.

· Work with the Growth Director to monitor CPA/CAC targets and assess end to end performance.

· Manage the pipeline, tests & strategic initiatives for Numan's PPC campaigns.

· Launch new products released by Numan into the PPC market creating profitable new acquisition channels.

· Assist in training junior staff to relieve some of the workload on yourself.

Operational:

· Take end to end responsibility for Numan's PPC campaigns, both brand and non-brand terms.

· Implement a best in class account structure and continue to drive down PPC CPA's across all terms.

· Continuously implementing new tests on all categories, optimising against a number of metrics.

· Launch new products into market.

· Be responsible for maintaining our tech stack and making sure we're ahead of the competition.

· Creating a best in class analytics suite with all our performance metrics available as and when we need them.

Requirements

· 2+ years of PPC experience, either in-house or agency-side.

· Expert knowledge in PPC, understanding of keyword types, search term analysis, ad copy generation, bidding, strategy, etc..

· Highly numerate - not afraid of tackling large datasets and creating meaningful insights.

· A curious mindset – you want to understand how things work and how you can improve them.

· A self-motivated and organised attitude. It's fast-paced here, so you'll need to be able to think on your feet and manage your time and projects.

Benefits

· A competitive salary.

· 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
· Own a share of the business.
· Choose your own equipment - Mac or PC whatever helps you be the most productive.
· A flexible working environment that allows you to work how you work best.
· A chance to build a category-defining company that’s making a real difference in people’s lives.

jobs.title: Medical Director
jobs.description:
Numan provides medicine for men and knowledge for everyone. We’re building a platform that gives men direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge so they can make informed decisions about their health. Our ambitions are big; we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re building a team to surpass them. We’re hiring a Medical Director to lead clinical strategy and operations for Numan.

Brief Description

Working directly alongside the CEO and the rest of the management team, the Medical Director will be responsible for the development and delivery of propositions that fulfill Numan’s promise to help men lead healthier and happier lives.

The role demands strong leadership qualities, high levels of cross-functional collaboration and the ability to influence across all levels of the organisation. The Medical Director will need to balance the requirement for strong strategic thinking; a need to execute in a fast-moving organisation and to ensure that all activities meet the regulatory and legal framework of the country they’re being delivered in.

Essential Functions

* Lead the evolution of Numan’s operating and therapeutic model across a number of conditions affecting male health.

* Directly influence the company’s strategic direction.

* Feed clinical requirements into the product roadmap.

* Build and develop a high-performing clinical function.

* Be a strong strategic partner to cross-functional colleagues including Commercial, Product Development Marketing, and Operations.

* Review and approve of medical and marketing materials and activities in line with national regulations and effective execution and maintenance of policies.

jobs.title: Mid-weight Copywriter
jobs.description:
Numan is changing the way men look after their health and wellness. We’re building a platform that gives direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge to make informed decisions about your health. We’re building a platform that gives you direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and knowledge to make informed decisions that are right for you. Our mission is to help men across the world live healthier, happier lives with Numan as their trusted, long-term partner for all things relating to their wellbeing.

Our ambitions are big, we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re growing a team to surpass them. We are hiring a Copywriter to bring a consistent tone of voice and communication style across all areas of the business from Product through to CRM.


What you will be doing:

* Writing copy that makes people feel excited about Male Health.
* From our Website copy to our emails we want our voice to feel consistent, engaging, jargon-free and human.
* You'll be a writer who can find the sweet spot between conversational, serious and playful with ease.
* You'll enjoy interrogating a brief and switching seamlessly between long website copy, emails, ads and FAQs (and won't mind doing the boring stuff, sometimes).
* You'll need to be able to grasp the intricacies of the pharmacy industry. Making sure all our copy is compliant while also engaging.
* You'll also need to be very confident expressing ideas and defending your choices, happy to get your teeth into anything.
* Reporting directly into the Chief Growth Officer you'll work as part of the product team.
*

Requirements

* 3+ years of copywriting experience, either in-house or agency-side.
* Experience optimising for SEO is beneficial but not essential.
* A portfolio of varied, interesting work that demonstrates both an aptitude for long copy and flair for snappy headlines and ideation/conceptual work.
* Proven experience crafting sparkling, straightforward customer-facing copy (and all the better if it started as dry, techy or otherwise inaccessible subject matter).
* Medical services/Pharmaceutical sector experience would be great, but not essential.
* Confidence and great communication. Our writers are the guardians of our tone of voice, so you should be happy to speak up and justify your decisions, fight for your ideas and develop relationships with departments and senior leaders company-wide.
* A self-motivated and organised attitude. It's fast-paced here, so you'll need to be able to think on your feet and manage your time and projects.

Benefits

* A competitive salary.
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
* Own a share of the business.
* Choose your own equipment - Mac or PC whatever helps you be the most productive.
* A flexible working environment that allows you to work how you work best
* A chance to build a category-defining company that’s making a real difference in people’s lives.

jobs.title: Product Manager
jobs.description:
Numan provides medicine for men and knowledge for everyone. We’re building a platform that gives men direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge to make informed decisions about their health. But we don’t stop there. For us, it’s a mission as much as it is a business. One to help men — and all that know them — live healthier, happier lives.

Our ambitions are big, we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re growing a team to surpass them. We are hiring a Product Manager to deliver our short term and long term product roadmap, and make our vision a reality.


What you will be doing:

* Internalising our vision of being the go-to resource for men’s wellness. We don’t just stop at physical products, think informative content, access to medical professionals and complete solutions, rather than simple fixes.
* Defining and owning the product roadmap, which will be become more complex as we grow.
* Managing the workflows across our development team, prioritising work and allocating resources.
* Optimising and testing our features, giving us the best ROI from our users.
* Reporting directly into the Chief Growth Officer you'll work as part of the product team.

Requirements

* 4+ years of experience in Product Management, managing end-to-end product lifecycles from discovery to release.
* Have a firm understanding of Agile and what it takes to deliver high quality products at speed.
* Have helped to create consumer-facing, tech-first products, ideally with some experience gained in a startups.
* A strong technical understanding, particularly of APIs and service infrastructure.
* You obsess about the customer and learning from them. You understand the psychology behind creating products which consumers love, and understand the path to making that happen.
* Are collaborative and a superb communicator. You work across different teams with ease and can translate creative ideas in technical language and visa versa.
* Have a degree in engineering, mathematics, development or design. Although this is an advantage, not an essential requirement.
* Are results-driven and action-oriented.
* Are familiar with analytics tools such as GA.
* Want to work for a brand with purpose and are passionate about health & wellness.

Benefits

* A competitive salary.
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
* Own a share of the business.
* Choose your own equipment - Mac or PC whatever helps you be the most productive.
* A flexible working environment that allows you to work how you work best
* A chance to build a category-defining company that’s making a real difference in people’s lives.

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.description:
Numan provides medicine for men and knowledge for everyone. We’re building a platform that gives men direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge to make informed decisions about their health. But we don’t stop there. For us, it’s a mission as much as it is a business. One to help men — and all that know them — live healthier, happier lives.

Our ambitions are big, we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re growing a team to surpass them.

We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our motivated and growing team. We are a fast-moving, agile team made up of experienced engineers that take pride in our work. Joining at the start of our journey means you will be making a huge impact on the ways that we develop and execute.

Technology Stack

Here are the main pieces of technology and tools that we are currently using:

* Ruby (and a bit of Golang), Rails, RSpec, PostgreSQL, Redis and Memcached for our web API services
* Node.js, Vue.js with Vuex and Nuxt.js, ES6, SCSS, Jest (and a bit of Cypress) and Webpack for our website
* Git, GitHub, CircleCI for our code and continuous integration/deployment
* Heroku and Cloudflare for our infrastructure
* Sentry, New Relic and Skylight for monitoring
* Jira for keeping us on track

What will you do?

You will be working in the API team, designing, implementing, maintaining, scaling and deploying the core of our business.

* Be instrumental in building a health platform that helps men take better care of themselves.
* Be hands-on with coding, best practices, appropriate tools and technologies. We are currently using Ruby and Golang in the web API services, however, we are flexible with considering alternatives wherever these are better for the business.
* Design domain models and business flows to implement new product features or 3rd party integrations and automation.
* Refactor code and automate end-to-end testing suites.
* Mentor, help and guide less experienced colleagues to help them up their game and become better engineers.
* Lead technical projects by working closely with our designers, product managers and marketers.
* Work with other parts of the business in clarifying requirements at the onset of projects and suggesting different and relevant technical approaches.

Requirements

* Have strong backend engineering experience. Ruby and Rails or Golang would be great, however, we are not fussy as long as you are able to adapt.
* Have strong experience in SQL, relational and non-relational databases. We use PostgreSQL and Redis but even if you are coming from different flavours you should be fine as long as you have a strong background.
* Have strong experience in designing and developing web APIs.
* Have strong experience in automated software testing.
* Care deeply about systems health and maintainability. Good engineering habits and best practices are very important to us.
* Might have experience in infrastructure automation and devops.
* Know how to make trade-offs, when to incur technical debt and how to repay it.
* Use your initiative and can work independently. You feel comfortable designing software systems and solutions and mentoring others.
* Can break down an ambitious vision into smaller components, prioritise the work and manage the team towards success.
* Have solid communication skills. You are able to work in cross-functional teams and collaborate effectively with remote team members.
* Take pride in your work and are always looking to improve, not settling for average.
* Want to work for a brand with purpose.
* Have a bias for action and are results-focused.

Benefits

* A competitive salary.
* Own a share of the business.
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
* Choose your own equipment - Mac or PC whatever helps you be the most productive.
* Continuous learning - Books, online subscriptions and budget for workshops and conferences
* A flexible and remote friendly working environment that allows you to work how you work best.
* A chance to build a category-defining company that’s making a real difference in people’s lives.

* Have strong backend engineering experience. Node.js would be great, however, we are not fussy as long as you are able to adapt.
* Have strong experience in SQL, relational and non-relational databases. We use PostgreSQL and Redis but even if you are coming from different flavours you should be fine as long as you have a strong background.
* Have strong experience in designing, developing and consuming web APIs.
* Have strong experience in building modern, scalable web applications.
* Care deeply about systems health and maintainability and have strong experience in automated software testing.
* Have strong experience in JavaScript and ES6.
* Have experience and feel comfortable working with any modern JS framework (Vue.js, AngularJS, React.js, Ember.js, etc)
* Have good knowledge in HTML and CSS.
* Care deeply about the end product.
* Know how to make trade-offs, when to incur technical debt and how to repay it.
* Use your initiative and can work independently. You feel comfortable designing software systems and solutions and mentoring others.
* Can break down an ambitious vision into smaller components, prioritise the work and manage the team towards success.
* Have solid communication skills. You are able to work in cross-functional teams and collaborate effectively with remote team members.
* Take pride in your work and are always looking to improve, not settling for average.
* Want to work for a brand with purpose.
* Have a bias for action and are results-focused.

Benefits

* A competitive salary.
* Own a share of the business.
* 25 days holiday + bank holidays.
* Choose your own equipment - Mac or PC whatever helps you be the most productive.
* Continuous learning - Books, online subscriptions and budget for workshops and conferences
* A flexible and remote friendly working environment that allows you to work how you work best.
* A chance to build a category-defining company that’s making a real difference in people’s lives.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.description:
Senior Product Designer

numan provides medicine for men and knowledge for everyone. We’re building a platform that gives men direct access to medical professionals, pharmaceutical products and the knowledge so they can make informed decisions about their health. But we don’t stop there. For us, it’s a mission as much as it is a business. One to help men — and all that know them — live healthier, happier lives.

Our ambitions are big, we’re working with top-tier investors to achieve them and we’re growing a team to surpass them. Part of our growth is to hire a Senior Product Manager who will be a driving force behind the creative direction of the numan brand. 

What will you do?
-Own and manage the Numan visual identity and creative direction.
-Work in partnership with our creative and advertising agencies to ensure that our brand and identity propagate through all of the advertising assets and material. 
-Ideate and create usable, visually outstanding, mobile-first designs for numan.com. 
-Work closely with the product, marketing and engineering teams to understand customer needs and develop concepts that inform the product roadmap. 
-Think through customer product interactions and design solutions that enhance the customer experience. 
-Work collaboratively with the development team to ensure that technical developments are meeting design guidelines. 
-Over time, build a strong design team to ensure that the needs of our growing company are always met. 

We would love to hear from you if: 
-You’re an experienced designer that believes visual and interaction design is intertwined - you want to create products that work as beautifully as they look! 
-You are comfortable with the full end-to end design processes from business requirements, to concepts, prototypes and final designs.  
-You have a solid understanding of UX and UI principles and have led user research projects. 
-You’ve helped to create and grow a brand from an early stage, however this is an advantage and not essential. 
-You are results driven and action-orientated.  
-Working for a brand with purpose excites you! A passion for health and wellbeing would be a huge advantage.
